title: Exchange Security Insights Online Collector
descriptionMarkdown: Connector used to push Exchange Online Security configuration for Microsoft Sentinel Analysis

sampleQueries.description: View how many Configuration entries exist on the table
sampleQueries.query: ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | summarize by GenerationInstanceID_g, EntryDate_s, ESIEnvironment_s

dataTypes.name: ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
            | summarize Time = max(EntryDate_s) by GenerationInstanceID_g, ESIEnvironment_s
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(EntryDate_s) by GenerationInstanceID_g, ESIEnvironment_s
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. Follow the steps for each Parser to create the Kusto Functions alias : [**ExchangeConfiguration**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-ESI-ExchangeCollector-ExchangeConfiguration-parser) and [**ESI_ExchConfigAvailableEnvironments**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-ESI-ExchangeCollector-ESIExchConfigAvailableEnvironments-parser)

instructionSteps.title: 1. Download the Parser files
instructionSteps.description: The latest version of the 2 files [**ExchangeConfiguration.txt**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-ESI-ExchangeCollector-ExchangeConfiguration-parser) and [**ExchangeEnvironmentList.txt**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-ESI-ExchangeCollector-ESIExchConfigAvailableEnvironments-parser)

instructionSteps.title: 2. Create Parser **ExchangeConfiguration** function
instructionSteps.description: In 'Logs' explorer of your Azure Sentinel's log analytics, copy the content of the file to Log explorer

instructionSteps.title: 3. Save Parser **ExchangeConfiguration** function
instructionSteps.description:
Click on save button.
 Define the parameters as asked on the header of the parser file.
Click save again.

instructionSteps.title: 4. Reproduce the same steps for Parser **ESI_ExchConfigAvailableEnvironments**
instructionSteps.description: Reproduce the step 2 and 3 with the content of 'ExchangeEnvironmentList.txt' file

>**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Automation to connect to 'Exchange Online' to pull its Security analysis into Azure Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Automation pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/automation/) for details.

**STEP 2 - Choose ONE from the following two deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure Automation**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the 'ESI Exchange Online Security Configuration' connector, have the Workspace ID and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the Exchange Online tenant name (contoso.onmicrosoft.com), readily available.

**Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template**

Use this method for automated deployment of the 'ESI Exchange Online Security Configuration' connector.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.Template/uri/https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FAzure%2FAzure-Sentinel%2Fmaster%2FSolutions%2FESI%2520-%2520Online%2520Exchange%2520Security%2520Configuration%2FData%2520Connectors%2Fazuredeploy_Connector_ESI_ExchangeOnlineCollector_AzureAutomation.json)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the **Workspace ID**, **Workspace Key**, **Tenant Name**, 'and/or Other required fields'. 
>4. Mark the checkbox labeled **I agree to the terms and conditions stated above**. 
5. Click **Purchase** to deploy.

**Option 2 - Manual Deployment of Azure Automation**

 Use the following step-by-step instructions to deploy the 'ESI Exchange Online Security Configuration' connector manually with Azure Automation.

instructionSteps.title: A. Create the Azure Automation Account
instructionSteps.description:
1.  From the Azure Portal, navigate to [Azure Automation Account](https://portal.azure.com/#view/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/Microsoft.Automation%2FAutomationAccounts).
2. Click **+ Add** at the top.
3. In the **Basics** tab, fill the required fields and give a name to the Azure Automation. 
4. In the **Advanced** and **Networking** and **Tags** Tabs, leave fields as default if you don't need to customize them.
5. 'Make other preferable configuration changes', if needed, then click **Create**.

instructionSteps.title: B. Add Exchange Online Management Module, Microsoft Graph (Authentication, User and Group) Modules
instructionSteps.description:
1. On the Automation Account page, select **Modules**.
2. Click on **Browse gallery** and search the **ExchangeOnlineManagement** module.
3. Select the it and click on **Select**.
4. Choose Version **5.1** on Runtime version field and click on Import button.
Repeat the step for the following modules : 'Microsoft.Graph.Authentication', 'Microsoft.Graph.Users' and 'Microsoft.Graph.Groups. **Attention, you need to wait for Microsoft.Graph.Authentication installation before processing next modules**

instructionSteps.title: C. Download the Runbook Content
instructionSteps.description:
1. Download the latest version of ESI Collector. The latest version can be found here : https://aka.ms/ESI-ExchangeCollector-Script
2. Unzip the file to find the JSON file and the PS1 file for next step.

instructionSteps.title: D. Create Runbook
instructionSteps.description:
1. On the Automation Account page, select the **Runbooks** button.
2. Click on **Create a runbook** and name it like 'ESI-Collector' with a runbook type **PowerShell**, Runtime Version **5.1** and click 'Create'.
2. Import the content of the previous step's PS1 file in the Runbook window.
3. Click on **Publish**

instructionSteps.title: E. Create GlobalConfiguration Variable
instructionSteps.description:
1. On the Automation Account page, select the **Variables** button.
2. Click on **Add a Variable** and name it exaclty 'GlobalConfiguration' with a type **String**.
2. On 'Value' field, copy the content of the previous step's JSON file.
3. Inside the content, replace the values of **WorkspaceID** and **WorkspaceKey**.
4. Click on 'Create' button.

instructionSteps.title: E. Create TenantName Variable
instructionSteps.description:
1. On the Automation Account page, select the **Variables** button.
2. Click on **Add a Variable** and name it exaclty 'TenantName' with a type **String**.
3. On 'Value' field, write the tenant name of your Exchange Online.
4. Click on 'Create' button.

instructionSteps.title: F. Create a Runbook Schedule
instructionSteps.description:
1. On the Automation Account page, select the **Runbook** button and click on your created runbook.
2. Click on **Schedules** and **Add a schedule** button.
3. Click on **Schedule**, **Add a Schedule** and name it. Select **Recurring** value with a reccurence of every 1 day, click 'Create'.
4. Click on 'Configure parameters and run settings'. Leave all empty and click on **OK** and **OK** again.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Create RunAs Account on Azure Automation
instructionSteps.description: The RunAs Account of an Azure Automation needs to be created manually. This account is used by the Runbook to access to Exhcange Online Configuration

instructionSteps.title: A. Create the Azure Automation Account
instructionSteps.description:
1. On the created Azure Automation Account, Click on 'Run As accounts'.
2. Click on **Azure Run As Account** and **Create**

instructionSteps.title: B. Exchange Online API delegation
instructionSteps.description:
1. As a **Global Administrator**, go to **App Registrations** and select the application beginning by your Azure Automation account name following by random letters.
2. Go to **API Permissions** and click on **Add a permission**.
3. On 'APIs my organization uses', search for 'Office 365 Exchange Online' app and select it.
4. Click on 'Applications permissions' and check 'Exchange.ManageAsApp' permission. Then click **Add Permissions**.
5. To grant permission, click on **Grant admin consent for contoso**.

instructionSteps.title: C. Exchange Online Role Assignment
instructionSteps.description:
1. As a **Global Administrator**, go to **Roles and Administrators**.
2. Select **Global Readers** role and click to 'Add assignments'.
3. Click on 'No member selected' and search your **RunAs account** beginning by the name of your automation account following by random letters. Select it and click on 'Select'.
4. Click **Next** and validate the assignment by clicking **Assign**.

instructionSteps.title: 4. Assign Microsoft Graph Permission
instructionSteps.description: To be able to retrieve User information and memberlist of admin groups, the automation account need multiple permission

parameters.title: Assign Microsoft Graph Users/Groups Read permission

instructionSteps.title: A. Microsoft Graph API Permission
instructionSteps.description:
1. As a **Global Administrator**, go to **App Registrations** and select the application nammed as your Azure Automation account name **without** following by random letters.
2. Go to **API Permissions** and click on **Add a permission**.
3. Select 'Microsoft Graph' application.
4. Click on 'Applications permissions' and check 'Group.Read.all' and 'User.Read.All' permissions. Then click **Add Permissions**.
5. To grant permission, click on **Grant admin consent for contoso**.
